revisions.rev: {{NCAATeamSeason |Mode=Basketball |sex=women |Year=2009-10 |Prev year=2008-09 |Next year=2010-11 |Team=Arizona State Sun Devils |Image= |Conference=Pacific-10 Conference |division= |ShortConference=Pac-10 |CoachRank= |APRank= |Record=4-1 |ConfRecord=0-0 |HeadCoach=Charli Turner Thorne |AsstCoach1=Joseph Anders |AsstCoach2=Meg Sanders |AsstCoach3=Laura Hughes |StadiumArena=[[Wells Fargo Arena (Tempe)|Wells Fargo Arena]] |capacity = |Champion=Rainbow Wahine Classic champions |BowlTourney= |BowlTourneyResult= }} {{2009â10 Pacific-10 Conference women's basketball standings}} The '''2009â10 Arizona State Sun Devils women's basketball team''' will represent [[Arizona State University]] in the [[2009â10 NCAA Division I women's basketball season]]. The Sun Devils will be coached by Charli Turner Thorne. The Sun Devils are a member of the [[Pacific-10 Conference]] and will attempt to win the NCAA championship. ==Offseason== *April 17, 2009: Sabrina McKinney and Tenaya Watson have signed national letters of intent to study and play basketball at Arizona State. Both will join the Sun Devils for the 2009-10 season. McKinney will be coming to ASU from Bowie High School in Arlington, Texas She was a two-time District 4-5A Defensive Player of the Year. A four-year starter, McKinney led her team in both assists and steals three straight seasons.http://thesundevils.cstv.com/sports/w-baskbl/spec-rel/041709aaa.html Watson A 5-9 guard from Long Beach, California. She previously played at Central Arizona College where she played a major role in leading her team to a perfect 35-0 season and the NJCAA championship. She put up All-American numbers as she averaged 13.8 points, 5.4 assists (13th in the nation) and 3.9 steals (fourth in the nation) per game. Shewas named the MVP of the NJCAA Tournament after averaging 16.8 points in the Vaqueras' four tournament games. *April 30: Head coach Charli Turner Thorne will serve as head coach of the 2009 USA Basketball Women's World University Games Team. Suzy Merchant of Michigan State University and Julie Rousseau of Pepperdine University wll serve as assistant coaches.http://thesundevils.cstv.com/sports/w-baskbl/spec-rel/043009aac.html ==Preseason== {|class="wikitable" width="80%" |- align="center" style=" background:#AF1E2D;color:#FFC61E;" | '''Date''' || '''Location''' || '''Opponent''' || '''Score''' || '''Record''' |- align="center" bgcolor="" | Nov. 5 || Tempe, AZ || Vanguard || 97-64 ||1-0 |- align="center" bgcolor="" |} ==Regular season== *The Sun Devils participated in the Rainbow Wahine Classic in Hawaii from November 27â28. On December 4, the club will host the ASU Classic. Before the end of December, the Sun Devils will participate in the Desert Sun Classic in Las Vegas. ===Roster=== {|class="wikitable sortable" width="80%" |- align="center" style="
